---
title: "05-LCNM_vs_LCnonNM"
author: "Bernie Mulvey"
date: "2025-05-12"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.height = 10,fig.width = 7,include = FALSE)
#### sets tab autocompletion for directories to begin from the directory containing the .Rproj session, instead of the script's directory if different
knitr::opts_knit$set(root.dir = here::here())

library(data.table)
library(spatialLIBD)
# library(SpatialFeatureExperiment)

## rstudio GUI tweaks
require(colorout)
ColorOut()
options("styler.addins_style_transformer" = "biocthis::bioc_style()")
##

## enable forked parallel processing with BiocParallel::multicoreParam, future::, etc. seemed to need this a couple times, but otherwise havent so its here as a preventative measure. part of this is adding the line 
# OBJC_DISABLE_INITIALIZE_FORK_SAFETY=YES
# to Renviron.site. see e.g. top response on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73638290/python-on-mac-is-it-safe-to-set-objc-disable-initialize-fork-safety-yes-globall 
library(parallelly)
options(parallelly.supportsMulticore.disableOn="")
options(parallelly.fork.enable=TRUE)
library(BiocParallel)
options(bphost="localhost")

## last of all, unload the base package datasets, whose data keep getting in the way of autocompletions (e.g., Theoph is priortized over TRUE)
unloadNamespace("datasets")
```

## load spe, clusters, and table of labels and NMseg subclusters
```{r}
lc3 <- readRDS("processed-data/06-countsOnly_noImgData_QCed_SPE_split_to_tissSections.RDS")

louvs <- readRDS("processed-data/07_featureSelection_dimred_harmony_clustering/04-Initial_louvLeid_res0.5-1-2_clusterings.RDS")
louvs <- louvs$HARMONYlmbna_HDG_SVG_2575[,.(rn,snnHARMONYlmbna_HDG_SVG_2575_louv_res1)]
setnames(louvs,2,"clusid")

anno <- fread("processed-data/08_validitycheck_25hdg75svg_louv1/10-25hdg75svg_louv1_annots.txt")
louvs <- merge.data.table(louvs,anno,by="clusid")
louvs <- DataFrame(louvs,row.names=louvs$rn)[colnames(lc3),]

colLabels(lc3) <- louvs$anno
rm(louvs,anno)

##
seglabs <- fread("processed-data/10_subclustering/04-LCsubclus-by-NM_otherclusts-by-LCorLCNMadjacency.txt")

## append these ^ and E4 copy number as a control variable
tmpcd <- as.data.table(colData(lc3),keep.rownames=T)
tmpcd <- merge.data.table(tmpcd,seglabs[,.(rn,LCadjacent,NMseg_subclus)],by="rn")

colData(lc3) <- DataFrame(tmpcd,row.names=tmpcd$rn)[colnames(lc3),]

## subset to LC cluster
lc3 <- lc3[,lc3$label=="LC"]
stopifnot(length(unique(lc3$NMseg_subclus))==2)

lc3$NMseg_subclus <- factor(lc3$NMseg_subclus,levels=c("LC_NMpos","LC_NMneg"))
```

## run marker analysis of NM+ vs NM- LC, controlling for age Sex and E4 copy number
```{r}
## fix APOE values to be limma passable
tmpcd <- as.data.table(colData(lc3))
tmpcd[APOE=="E2/ E3",APOE:="E2het"]
tmpcd[APOE=="E2/ E2",APOE:="E2hom"]
tmpcd[APOE=="E3/ E4",APOE:="E4het"]
tmpcd[APOE=="E4/ E4",APOE:="E4hom"]
colData(lc3) <- DataFrame(tmpcd,row.names=tmpcd$rn)[colnames(lc3),]

nmmk <- registration_wrapper(lc3,var_registration = "NMseg_subclus",var_sample_id = "sample_id",gene_ensembl = "gene_id",gene_name = "gene_name",min_ncells = 5,covars = c("Sex","Age","APOE"))

nmmk <- as.data.table(nmmk$enrichment)
keepn <- c("gene",grep(names(nmmk),pattern="NMpos",value=T),"ensembl")
nmmk <- nmmk[,..keepn]

nmmk <- melt.data.table(nmmk,id.vars=c("ensembl","gene"))
nmmk[,stat:=gsub(variable,pattern="^(.*)_LC.*$",replacement="\\1")]


nmmkt <- nmmk[stat=="t_stat"]
setnames(nmmkt,"value","t_stat")
nmmkt[,variable:=NULL]
nmmkt[,stat:=NULL]

nmmkp <- nmmk[stat=="p_value"]
setnames(nmmkp,"value","p_value")
nmmkp[,variable:=NULL]
nmmkp[,stat:=NULL]

nmmkf <- nmmk[stat=="fdr"]
setnames(nmmkf,"value","fdr")
nmmkf[,variable:=NULL]
nmmkf[,stat:=NULL]

nmmkl <- nmmk[stat=="logFC"]
setnames(nmmkl,"value","logFC")
nmmkl[,variable:=NULL]
nmmkl[,stat:=NULL]

nmmk2 <- merge.data.table(nmmkl,nmmkf,by=c("ensembl","gene"))
nmmk2 <- merge.data.table(nmmk2,nmmkp,by=c("ensembl","gene"))
nmmk2 <- merge.data.table(nmmk2,nmmkt,by=c("ensembl","gene"))

nmmk2[,clus:="LC_NMpos"]

nameord <- c("clus","gene","logFC","fdr","p_value","t_stat","ensembl")
nmmk2 <- nmmk2[,..nameord]
```

save
```{r}
fwrite(nmmk2,"processed-data/10_subclustering/05-LC_NMpos-vs-NMneg_markers_covarSexAgeE4copies.txt",sep='\t',quote=F,row.names=F,col.names=T)
```
